page.title: 17Religion in Wootton
page.content: Wootton has 3 churches, RC, C of E and Methodist.Only the Anglican church has a {resident vicar,}he also cares for Dry Sandford parish. The church dates from at least the 14th Century, its stone cross by the gate is 700 years old.It was first run from the Cumnor parish, exactly 100 years ago it became independent. The centenary was celebrated on St Peter's day by a Friday evening performance of harp music given in the Church.The Vicar of Cumnor was invited to preach at the 10a.m. Sunday Service, this was followed by coffee and a parish photograph taken outside the church beneath the{mass dial.}The grooves of the dial used to indicate the times of church services. There are plans to build a wooden gallery inside the church to house a new organ and provide more floor space.
